channel.title: Blog
channel.description: Resources and news in the areas of teaching, genocide, world history, and human rights.

item.title: Genocide in Darfur
item.description:
This is an ongoing and brutal attack on civilians in the south of the Sudan involving issues of oil resources, race, religion, civil war, political expediency, international stumbling, and many more. Hundreds of thousands have died since early 2003.

Genocide in Darfur
Links Regarding the Genocide in Darfur
Films Dealing with the Genocide in Darfur & Sudan
Bibliography of the Darfur Genocide

On a lighter note, I have added links to connect with me on various social media to the About Me page. The myspace page is not yet set up, and the flickr account is shared with my husband, but everything else has initial content. (The red paperclip is a link to my resumé)

item.title: Indonesian Massacres
item.description:
I’ve been traveling a lot the last couple weeks. I was lucky enough to tag along on my husband’s business trip to Pisa, Italy with my little girl. It was so exciting for me, and Josie heard lots of “Ciao Bella”.

To get back into the swing of things a bit, I am starting by putting up a couple small pages. The first is the Links Regarding the Indonesian Massacres, and the second is the topic page for Indonesian Massacres. I have already put up a page for a Bibliography of the Indonesian Massacres.

item.title: Bangladesh Liberation War of 1971
item.description: The Bangladesh Liberation War of 1971 was the rationale for the Pakistani army to adopt policies that resulted in a great number of deaths, most commonly estimated to be between 200,000 and 3 million. An additional 8-10 million people fled to India as refugees from the violence. I have put up pages for Links Regarding the Genocide in Bangladesh and Bibliography of the Bangladesh Genocide as well as set up a topic page for Genocide in Bangladesh. If you know of any films or additional web or book resources I should post, please let me know.

item.title: Genocide in East Timor
item.description: I have put together a page for Links Regarding the Genocide in East Timor. There isn’t much, but it should help anyone interested get started in finding resources for their research. I have also previously put up a page for a Bibliography of the Genocide in East Timor - again, not much, but a start. If you have any resources that aren’t listed here, I’d be glad to hear about them, so please email me! This also means that the main topic page for Genocide in East Timor should be finished sometime this week. I hope to get more done than just that, but it is looking like a very busy time.

item.title: Professional Publications & Associations
item.description:
Professional publications and associations are important to understanding your field of research, but if you are like me and not going directly from undergraduate to graduate studies, it may be difficult to locate sources. I have put together the following pages to help others be on top of recent debates in world history, teaching, genocide and human rights studies.

Links for Discussion Lists
Links for Magazines
Links for University World History & Genocide Studies Departments

I will be adding the Links for Journals & Reviews over the weekend.

item.title: Recommendations & Updates
item.description:
I have changed the Search for this site and moved it to the top menu, but it still doesn’t seem to be working. I’m trying to get help repairing it, and after that will be left to repair is the RSS feed link.

I have added a Definitions of Killing page to help clear up the confusion between so many overlapping terms dealing with mass murder. I will be adding to it and clarifying it for the future, and comments are appreciated. Back in 2005, I made a handout on this topic for discussion in a class I was taking. It includes examples of each, and if I’m correct, you can download it by clicking here: Semantics of Mass Murder.pdf.

I have added recommendations from Pete Fredlake to the Bibliography of Ethnic Cleansing in the Former Yugoslavia and Links for Teacher Training & Organizations.

Kristyn Moravetz has recommended two books for the Bibliography of Human Rights & Women, and those have been the first additions to that list.

My excellent former T.A., David Armstead, is working on finding information to add to the information linked to the Hate topic page.

This weekend I was able to go Washington D.C. and touch bases with the director of the United States Holocaust Museum’s Teacher Fellowship program, Mr. Pete Fredlake, and get some help from the Smithsonian African Art Museum’s head librarian Dr. Janet Stanley. Both are extremely kind and helpful, and I recommend both institutions for help with learning and teaching without reservation.

item.title: Hello Again!
item.description:
I have to apologize for being gone so long. It was a crazy month. Here are my personal updates: I finished the GRE (yay!), one of my cats passed away and the other is all better, and my little girl had her first birthday. Now I am focusing on this site, reading, and figuring out the PhD application process.

Since I last wrote, I have updated the following pages:
Links for Websites by Teachers
Links for Presentations & Lectures
Links for University World History & Genocide Studies Departments
Links for Projects & Portfolios
Links for University Professor & Course Sites
Links for Outlines, Notes & Timelines

I am anxious to move back into collecting research material, and once that is complete, and this site has a good, solid foundation, I’d like to add my own original curriculum. I have eight years of it, but I need to organize and convert it to a computer-friendly format.

On a side note, I recently finished Adam Jones’ textbook on genocide and found it to be an incredibly useful tool and would recommend it for any undergraduate or graduate introduction.

item.title: Lesson Planning
item.description:
My poor cats are gravely ill, and I am studying for the GRE in a couple weeks, so there won’t be many entries this month. I have updated and added a lot of resources to the Links for Curriculum page and finished formatting the links on the Teaching page.

When I get a chance, the pages I will be updating and adding to, hopefully to be finished before July, are the following:
Links for Websites by Teachers
Links for Presentations & Lectures
Links for Outlines, Notes & Timelines
Links for University Professor & Course Sites
Links for University World History & Genocide Studies Departments

Please let me know what thoughts you have on content and format. I would really appreciate it.

item.title: Site Updates
item.description:
Due to the size of this site, I am listing here, Site Guide, all the pages that have initial content on them and are ready for viewing. Each page listed on the Site Guide is also linked elsewhere on bylochacon.com by topic, type of resource and blog post.

Also, I just fixed the email links on all the pages (I think), so it should work now. The RSS feed is still broken, as is the google search on each page. I’ll work on getting those up and running as soon as I can figure out how.

I generally work on one page a day, but am continuing to add links to other pages as I find them. If you email suggestions, I would be happy to add them right away.

Today I have finished the Links for History Humor, Fun & Games. Teachers, please use these resources with care, as every silly website does not have one-hundred percent student-friendly material.

item.title: Teaching Tools
item.description:
I loved teaching high school history, but it was exhausting for me because I wanted to do everything right. It was like swimming up river. I spent hundreds of hours searching for resources, collecting links and books and videos, and trying to find the best stuff I could.

Here I have collected as many resources as I could find that are actually useful to the classroom history teacher. Any suggestions would be greatly appreciated - please email me with them.
Teaching - main topic page
Teaching Tools & Downloads - sub-topic page
Links for Portfolios
Links for Puzzles & Games
Links for Presentations & Lectures
Links for Rubrics & Grading
Links for Calendars & Assignment Trackers
Links for Graphic Organizers
Links for Tests & Quizzes
Links for Making-Your-Own Site, Forums & Message Boards
Links for Tools for Teachers
Links for Printable Materials

(Only two more teacher resource pages and there will be initial content on every teacher-related page!)
